newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler to idle 2 car plants next week.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler to idle 2 car plants next week.

text.p: Chrysler Corp, which suffered a 17.9 percent drop in U.S. car sales last month, said Thursday it will idle two car plants next week.

Chrysler said its Belvidere, Ill., plant that makes Neon small cars and its Sterling Heights, Mich., plant, which produces the Stratus, Cirrus and Breeze sedans, will not operate next week because of inventory adjustments.
The production halts will affect about 4,900 hourly workers at the plants. Belvidere normally makes 5,320 units a week. Sterling Heights produces 4,925 cars a week.
Chrysler said its Newark Del., plant will not operate due to a model changeover. All three of its Canadian plants will operate the week of June 9.
Ford Motor Co said all of its U.S. and Canadian plants are scheduled to operate next week.

Ford said it is running overtime this week at light truck plants in St. Thomas, Ontario; Wayne, Mich.; Kansas City; Lorain, Ohio; Kentucky Truck; Louisvile, Ky.; Norfolk, Va.; Oakville, Ontario; Ontario Truck; and St. Louis.
General Motors Corp said it has not scheduled any downtime for next week. Light truck plants in Fort Wayne, Ind., Janesville, Wis., and Oshawa, Ontario, are scheduled to run overtime next week.
